p: However, apigenin, and kaempferol showed better binding energy values than the reference drug of the active site of colchicine, which suggests that this could be their mechanism of action to exert an antiproliferative effect [ 34]. Phytochemical exploration and characterization of the extracts could lead to the discovery of the potential bioactive properties of medicinal plants, and this principle coincides with findings in this work, where the antioxidative selection of fractions allowed for further assays [ 35, 36, 37].
